        public boolean createTrigger(java.lang.String triggerName,
                             java.lang.String script)
                      throws AbstractTriggerManager.TriggerInitFailedException,
                             java.io.IOException
        Create trigger. Interval is 1000L by default.
        Parameters:
        triggerName - name of the trigger.
        script - the code.
        Returns:
        true on success; false if already exists.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - See Trigger#init()
        LexerException - See Trigger#init()
        ParserException - See Trigger#init()
        AbstractTriggerManager.TriggerInitFailedException

      • deleteTrigger

        public boolean deleteTrigger(java.lang.String triggerName)
        Completely clean up the Repeating Trigger. This also stops the thread if one was running already.
        Parameters:
        triggerName - name of the trigger
        Returns:
        true on success; false if trigger with the name not found.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning(java.lang.String triggerName)
        Checks whether the specified trigger is running. However, this also can return false even if the trigger with name 'triggerName' does not exists.
        Parameters:
        triggerName -
        Returns:

      • startTrigger

        public boolean startTrigger(java.lang.String triggerName)
        Attempts to start the trigger with provided trigger name. Return false if no such trigger with that name, yet return value of true does not necessarily start the thread; it checks if the trigger thread is already running, and if it is running, it will skip. So return value true actually just guarantees that the repeating trigger is running. If you want to check whether the repeating trigger is running, use isRunning(String) instead.
        Parameters:
        triggerName - name of the repeating trigger.
        Returns:
        true on success; false if trigger not found.

      • stopTrigger

        public boolean stopTrigger(java.lang.String triggerName)
        Attempts to stop the trigger.
        Parameters:
        triggerName - name of the repeating trigger.
        Returns:
        true on success; false if no such trigger found with name.
